message.content:
cs.CV, cs.HC, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category as it deals with the automatic spotting of micro-expressions from facial images. It also involves the use of machine learning techniques for analysis, which is a common theme in the computer vision field. 

It could also belong to the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category as the research aims to assist human-oriented tasks by providing important cues through micro-expression spotting. 

Multimedia (cs.MM) is another possible sub-category as the research involves the analysis of facial images, which is a type of multimedia data. 

Machine learning (cs.LG) is also a likely sub-category as the paper discusses the use of machine learning tools for micro-expression spotting. 

Finally, information retrieval (cs.IR) is a possible sub-category as the research involves the development of a benchmark for evaluating micro-expression spotting methods, which could be seen as a type of information retrieval task.
